messages.message:
would checking out the unwanted changed files work here as a fix?
In my PR I have just added a feature flag in config.proto

The feature flag works irrespective of the additional changed files

> would checking out the unwanted changed files work here as a fix?
probably?

but it's still concerning that you're getting these extra changes - what are the changes in the unexpectedly changed files?

also, are you sure you're based off of master?
cc @Xindi Xu as well when you're online

```\x42\x19Z\x17instabase/protos/ibprog```
this string is getting added in one of the files, other files also have a similar string getting added

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/71279/commits/f08d3ba37ecb809daa11fe2a10e910a30b29f4ea - in this commit ive reverted those file changes to master, you can see the changes fully there in the pb2 files

DESCRIPTOR._options = None

this is also added at the end of files

When we add `FAST=false` flag, it tries to regenerate all proto stubs, even if the source .proto files are unchanged. If you run the same command on master, without your changes to `config.protos` , do you see the same updates?
ill try this, btw is checking out to master on those files a valid resolution?
yep it changes only those extra files this time
we could, but i think we should fix these stubs on master.
ok then, maybe you should just include all these changes in your PR then? @anshul.padhi
@Xindi Xu? I have already reverted those files but running the build proto should add those files back again, should I do that?
